event: Early Chinese states emerge along the Yellow River
Shang dynasty develops bronze culture and early writing
Zhou dynasty introduces the Mandate of Heaven
Warring States period accelerates philosophy and warfare
Qin unifies China under centralized imperial rule
Han dynasty institutionalizes bureaucracy and Confucianism
Papermaking spreads literacy and administration
Han collapse fragments China into rival kingdoms
Sui dynasty reunifies China and builds the Grand Canal
Tang dynasty fosters cosmopolitan culture and Silk Road trade
An Lushan Rebellion weakens Tang imperial authority
China fractures during the Five Dynasties period
Song dynasty advances commerce, cities, and technology
Northern China lost to nomadic Jin rule
Mongol Yuan dynasty integrates China into a Eurasian empire
Ming dynasty restores Han Chinese governance
Zheng He leads large-scale maritime expeditions
Manchu Qing dynasty conquers China
Qing incorporates Taiwan into imperial rule
Internal rebellions signal Qing decline
Opium Wars force treaty ports open
Imperial system ends with the fall of the Qing dynasty
Communist victory reunifies mainland China
